network_overview: The capture shows a lightly-loaded 4G EPC control-plane snapshot: S1-AP keep-alives between eNB and MME, sporadic GTP-C echo traffic, and CG-NAT DNS bursts on SGi. Every Diameter procedure (Cmd-318/316/324) fails with Result-Code 2001 (Busy), indicating the HSS/PCRF front-end is rejecting all requests, while S1-AP and GTP-C planes remain stable.

observations.finding: Diameter result-code 2001 (Busy) returned for 100 % of Cx/S6a requests (Cmd-318, 316, 324) across three different sessions
S1-AP success rate 0 % reported, yet 27 bidirectional messages exchanged without explicit S1-AP error causes; metric likely reflects lack of positive outcome PDUs in parser
Zero SIP/RTP/VoLTE flows; IMS signalling totally absent

root_causes.description: All observed Diameter answers carry Result-Code 2001 (DIAMETER_BUSY). The same HSS instance (10.47.9.68) replies immediately, suggesting it is online but throttling every request, probably due to CPU/license limit or intentional rate-guard.
root_causes.impact: Subscribers cannot attach, detach, or modify bearers; effectively no new EPS sessions can be established.

recommendations.action: Investigate HSS 10.47.9.68 load: check CPU, active sessions, licence capacity and Diameter watchdog settings; if overloaded, enable load-share to standby HSS or increase licence limits.
recommendations.rationale: Eliminating the 2001 Busy replies will restore attach and bearer-modify success.

recommendations.action: Verify MME behaviour on 2001: ensure it re-attempts via alternate HSS and backs-off exponentially rather than dropping subscribers.
recommendations.rationale: Proper back-off protects the HSS and improves attach success once HSS recovers.

recommendations.action: Add VoLTE IMS capture point (P-CSCF/SBC) to validate that voice service is unaffected once data attach is repaired.
recommendations.rationale: Current trace lacks SIP visibility; cannot confirm voice health.

session_analysis.signaling_health: S1-AP and GTP-C planes stable (low-rate keep-alives, no errors). Diameter S6a/Cx completely blocked by 2001 Busy replies.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: No GTP-U tunnels observed; user-plane is idle. Short DNS bursts on SGi-LAN (CG-NAT) are normal UE activity.
session_analysis.voice_quality: No SIP or RTP detected; IMS signalling absent, hence voice service unavailable.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: Control-plane rejection (Diameter) prevents any EPS bearer creation, so user-plane and voice bearers cannot be established.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant MME
    participant HSS
    Note over MME,HSS: All Diameter procedures fail with 2001 Busy
    MME->>HSS: Cmd-318 Update-Location-Request (pkt_1)
    HSS->>MME: Cmd-318 Result-Code 2001 Busy (pkt_4)
    MME->>HSS: Cmd-316 Insert-Subscriber-Data-Req (pkt_15)
    HSS->>MME: Cmd-316 Result-Code 2001 Busy (pkt_16)
    MME->>HSS: Cmd-324 Pur-UE-Request (pkt_17)
    HSS->>MME: Cmd-324 Result-Code 2001 Busy (pkt_20)
    Note right of HSS: HSS online but throttling every request
